notes.short:
This is test service to validate the protocol packet transmissions between the browser and a MCU.
Use this page if you are porting Jacdac to a new platform.
notes.long:
### Test procedure

For each ``rw`` registers, set a random value ``x``
  * read ``rw`` and check value is equal to ``x``
  * read ``ro`` and check value is equal to ``x``
  * listen to ``e`` event and check that data is equal to ``x``
  * call ``c`` command with new random value ``y``
  * read ``rw`` and check value is equal to ``y``
  * do all the above steps with acks

For each ``rw`` registers, there shall also
be an ``event`` and a ``command``. The event
should get raised when the value changes;
and the command should set the value.
notes.registers:
Every ``rw`` register has a corresponding ``ro`` regisrer
and a corresponding ``set_...`` command to also set the value.

packets.name: command_not_implemented
packets.description:
This report may be emitted by a server in response to a command (action or register operation)
that it does not understand.
The `service_command` and `packet_crc` fields are copied from the command packet that was unhandled.
Note that it's possible to get an ACK, followed by such an error report.

packets.name: instance_name
packets.description:
A friendly name that describes the role of this service instance in the device.
It often corresponds to what's printed on the device:
for example, `A` for button A, or `S0` for servo channel 0.
Words like `left` should be avoided because of localization issues (unless they are printed on the device).

packets.name: status_code
packets.description:
Reports the current state or error status of the device. ``code`` is a standardized value from 
the Jacdac status/error codes. ``vendor_code`` is any vendor specific error code describing the device
state. This report is typically not queried, when a device has an error, it will typically
add this report in frame along with the announce packet. If a service implements this register,
it should also support the ``status_code_changed`` event defined below.

packets.name: client_variant
packets.description:
An optional register in the format of a URL query string where the client can provide hints how
the device twin should be rendered. If the register is not implemented, the client library can simulate the register client side.

packets.name: status_code_changed
packets.description: Notifies that the status code of the service changed.

packets.name: rw_bool
packets.description: A read write bool register.

packets.name: ro_bool
packets.description: A read only bool register. Mirrors rw_bool.

packets.name: rw_u32
packets.description: A read write u32 register.

packets.name: ro_u32
packets.description: A read only u32 register.. Mirrors rw_u32.

packets.name: rw_i32
packets.description: A read write i32 register.

packets.name: ro_i32
packets.description: A read only i32 register.. Mirrors rw_i32.

packets.name: rw_string
packets.description: A read write string register.

packets.name: ro_string
packets.description: A read only string register. Mirrors rw_string.

packets.name: rw_bytes
packets.description: A read write string register.

packets.name: ro_bytes
packets.description: A read only string register. Mirrors ro_bytes.

packets.name: rw_i8_u8_u16_i32
packets.description: A read write i8, u8, u16, i32 register.

packets.name: ro_i8_u8_u16_i32
packets.description: A read only i8, u8, u16, i32 register.. Mirrors rw_i8_u8_u16_i32.

packets.name: rw_u8_string
packets.description: A read write u8, string register.

packets.name: ro_u8_string
packets.description: A read only u8, string register.. Mirrors rw_u8_string.

packets.name: e_bool
packets.description: An event raised when rw_bool is modified

packets.name: e_u32
packets.description: An event raised when rw_u32 is modified

packets.name: e_i32
packets.description: An event raised when rw_i32 is modified

packets.name: e_string
packets.description: An event raised when rw_string is modified

packets.name: e_bytes
packets.description: An event raised when rw_bytes is modified

packets.name: e_i8_u8_u16_i32
packets.description: An event raised when rw_i8_u8_u16_i32 is modified

packets.name: e_u8_string
packets.description: An event raised when rw_u8_string is modified

packets.name: c_bool
packets.description: A command to set rw_bool.

packets.name: c_u32
packets.description: A command to set rw_u32.

packets.name: c_i32
packets.description: A command to set rw_i32.

packets.name: c_string
packets.description: A command to set rw_string.

packets.name: c_bytes
packets.description: A command to set rw_string.

packets.name: c_i8_u8_u16_i32
packets.description: A command to set rw_bytes.

packets.name: c_u8_string
packets.description: A command to set rw_u8_string.

packets.name: c_report_pipe
packets.description: A command to read the content of rw_bytes, byte per byte, as a pipe.

packets.name: p_bytes
packets.description: A command to read the content of rw_bytes, byte per byte, as a pipe.
